intro: Modecca formosana, commonly known as the Formosan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and has a taproot system that allows it to thrive in well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers are followed by fluffy white seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Modecca formosana is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, contributing to the local flora diversity.
